CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "Jimmy Simmons, 2306 Centre Avenue, Corner Tavern, Wylie Avenue at Fullerton Street.  'Yes, by all means, but providing that the AFL Bartenders' Union will accept them as bartenders and not as waiters, porters, bell-hops, etc. That's the only way that we should affiliate ourselves.  I have nothing more to say.'"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender Jimmy Simmons posed holding cigarette, behind bar with photographs, in Corner Tavern, Wylie Avenue and Fullerton Street
